org.geotools.referencefork.referencing.operation.builder
Class MappedPosition

java.lang.Object
  org.geotools.referencefork.referencing.operation.builder.MappedPosition
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DisactivableMappedPosition
public class MappedPosition
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

An association between a source and target direct positions. Accuracy information and comments can optionnaly be attached.

Since:
2.4
Version:
$Id: MappedPosition.java 28081 2007-11-27 23:17:34Z desruisseaux $
Author:
Jan Jezek, Martin Desruisseaux
See Also:

Constructor Detail

MappedPosition

public MappedPosition(int dimension)
Creates a mapped position with source and target position of the specified dimension. The initial coordinate values are 0.

MappedPosition

public MappedPosition(org.opengis.spatialschema.geometry.DirectPosition source,
                      org.opengis.spatialschema.geometry.DirectPosition target)
Creates a mapped position from the specified direct positions.

Parameters:
source - The original direct position.
target - The associated direct position.
Method Detail

getSource

public org.opengis.spatialschema.geometry.DirectPosition getSource()
Returns the source direct position. For performance reasons, the current implementation returns a reference to the internal object. However users should avoid to modify directly the returned position and use setSource(org.opengis.spatialschema.geometry.DirectPosition) instead.

setSource

public void setSource(org.opengis.spatialschema.geometry.DirectPosition point)
Set the source direct position to the specified value.

getTarget

public org.opengis.spatialschema.geometry.DirectPosition getTarget()
Returns the target direct position. For performance reasons, the current implementation returns a reference to the internal object. However users should avoid to modify directly the returned position and use setTarget(org.opengis.spatialschema.geometry.DirectPosition) instead.

setTarget

public void setTarget(org.opengis.spatialschema.geometry.DirectPosition point)
Set the target direct position to the specified value.

getComments

public java.lang.String getComments()
Returns the comments attached to this mapping, or null if none.

setComments

public void setComments(java.lang.String comments)
Set the comments attached to this mapping. May be null if none.

getAccuracy

public double getAccuracy()
Returns an estimation of mapping accuracy in units of target CRS axis, or Double.NaN if unknow.

setAccuracy

public void setAccuracy(double accuracy)
Set the accuracy.

getError

public final double getError(org.opengis.referencing.operation.MathTransform transform,
                             org.opengis.spatialschema.geometry.DirectPosition buffer)
                      throws org.opengis.referencing.operation.TransformException
Computes the distance between the source point transformed by the supplied math transform, and the target point.

Parameters:
transform - The transform to use for computing the error.
buffer - An optionnaly pre-computed direct position to use as a buffer, or null if none. The content of this buffer will be overwritten.
Returns:
The distance in units of the target CRS axis.
Throws:
org.opengis.referencing.operation.TransformException

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns a hash code value for this mapped position.

Compares this mapped position with the specified object for equality.
